result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bond form returned unsigned. Def refused.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 6/28/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MEM. 
- Defendant shall not be on Crawling Stone Rd in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- If the defendant posts cash bail and if the defendant is taken by the juvenile Dept of Corrections, they are to notify the State, defense counsel, and the court one week prior to the change in the defendant's custody status.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
Arguments heard; arguments heard; Ct grants the motion to modify bond; $5000 cash; all other conditions to remain the same WITH THE EXCEPTION of "Defendant shall not be in Dane County except as necessary only to attend court or meet with criminal defense counsel" (which is deleted); Ct adds bond condition - if defn posts bail and if defn is taken by juvenile dept of corrections, they are to notify the State, defense counsel and the court one week prior to the change in defn's custody staus
